content.description: Start standing on the far left side of the boulder on the jug before the massive crystal feature jug. Do some fun campus moves up the perfect slopers to the corner of the boulder and the good sloper there. Look around and grab a weird horizontal pinch where your thumb slots into a hole, crank your foot onto the mini face straight below you and then the pinch starts helping, you crank up and topout.

Under the roof on the far left side start on poor right hand crimp and a better crimp gaston (which I believe is now gone) for your left. Make a hard move left to the lower lip and continue up to top out on Red Summer Sun.  Originally this climb was graded V8.  In 2011 the second hold broke off, and the only information about the climb I could find was a YouTube video from 2015 where the new proposed grade was V10.  

 If I am missing any information, please let me know!
content.location: Far left end of the roof.

content.description: Start sitting low on the very first jug on the right side of the boulder, traverse good holds left into incut crimps and do a large move left to a right facing jug, continue traversing left to a little around the corner of the boulder to top out as Red Summer Sun.
Start on two crimps at the bottom right of the overhung face. Do one big move to a mini-jug and climb Deeper Than Bones. Cruxy first move, relatively chill finish.

pathTokens: Rocky Gorge Reservoir  (T. Howard Duckett Reservoir)

content.description: The first prominent boulder located past the massive, blank roof. Hosts multiple climbs, though those that are included on this page are only the most frequently climbed.  See rockclimbing.com/routes/Nor… for more information/climbs.
